intro: Chysis pluricostata, commonly known as the multi-costate chysis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in axillary inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Chysis pluricostata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
